Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2012 06:57AM Chickenlady wrote: About the injection.. the nurse applied a topical anethestic cream around the nipple area of my breast and covered it with a clear plastic bandage for about an hour before the injection. I joked that it looked just a bit like an apple cream cheese danish.  Two injections, the second was the worst... of course. My sister was with me.. thankful she was there to make me laugh.  Breast needed to be massaged after for a few minutes to help the dye move through the system. My boob did not turn blue, nor did I notice blue pee.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2012 11:33AM Chickenlady wrote: Hello Everyone.. well.. two weeks post surgery.  BS says incision is healing nicely. Has anyone else had the oncotype? (i think that's the spelling? ) test done?  Waiting for results to come tomorrow. Hoping for a low score ( which, is really hard for me to accept, since I"ve been raised to always want a high score). Low score means no chemo. Getting my tats for radiation on Wed and meeting oncologist.  If I get a high score, then I'm off to chemo. Intermediate means we have a "talk" about what happens next. Armpit incision is still painful....although the surgical tape is almost all gone.. i think that's what has been causing the pulling?  but don't know.  Glad to hear of everyone's progress..
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2012 01:42PM Chickenlady wrote: Surgery went well, sentinel nodes look good, but will get path report by thursday. Hardest part was that injection for the sentinel nodes. I also have a sore throat from the breathing tube during surgery.  Makes it hard to talk.. but won't whine about that!!! A heart shaped pillow under my arm is a good thing to have!!!
